body:
> A google search will show there are many who wish to access this - perhaps
for logging, or associating other records (although, I agree it's better to
simply store an associated record id in the session).

Also this. It seems a bad idea in the first place, why are we making it easier?

Authentication mechanisms (like Devise) will set a new session id once you change your password, sign in and other actions to avoid session fixation attacks, why are you sticking with something that will change?

I would like to hear some good example where this is needed and manually managing a record id wouldn't suffice.
